He eventually ventured into the world of drug trafficking, and by the early 1980s, he had formed the Guadalajara Cartel along with Rafael Caro Quintero and Ernesto Fonseca Carrillo.

The Guadalajara Cartel was a powerful drug trafficking organization responsible for smuggling large quantities of marijuana, cocaine, and other drugs into the United States. Félix Gallardo was known as "El Padrino" (The Godfather) due to his role as the cartel's leader and his ability to organize various factions of the drug trade under one umbrella. Under his leadership, the cartel forged alliances with powerful Colombian drug lords, including Pablo Escobar, which allowed them to expand their operations.

In 1985, the murder of DEA agent Enrique "Kiki" Camarena brought international attention to the Guadalajara Cartel and ultimately led to its downfall. As a result of increased scrutiny and pressure from law enforcement, Félix Gallardo decided to divide the cartel's territories among his trusted lieutenants, which gave rise to some of Mexico's most powerful drug organizations, such as the Sinaloa, Tijuana, and Juarez cartels.

Félix Gallardo was arrested in Mexico on April 8, 1989, and charged with numerous crimes, including drug trafficking, racketeering, and the murder of Enrique Camarena. He was convicted and sentenced to a 40-year prison term. Currently, he is serving his sentence in a maximum-security prison in Mexico.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Shakira.
output:
Shakira Isabel Mebarak Ripoll, professionally known as Shakira, is a Colombian singer, songwriter, dancer, record producer, and philanthropist. Born on February 2, 1977, in Barranquilla, Colombia, she is of Lebanese, Spanish, and Italian descent. Shakira began her music career at a young age, releasing her first album, "Magia," in 1990 when she was just 13 years old. However, it wasn't until her fifth album, "¿Dónde Están los Ladrones?" (1998), that she achieved widespread recognition in Latin America.

Shakira's crossover to the English-speaking market came with her fifth studio album, "Laundry Service" (2001), which featured the hit singles "Whenever, Wherever" and "Underneath Your Clothes." This album established her as an international superstar and marked the beginning of her global success.

Throughout her career, Shakira has won numerous awards, including multiple Grammy Awards, Latin Grammy Awards, and American Music Awards. She has also been nominated for Golden Globe and MTV Video Music Awards. As of 2021, she is one of the best-selling Latin music artists of all time, having sold over 75 million records worldwide.

In addition to her music career, Shakira is known for her philanthropy and activism. In 1997, she founded the Pies Descalzos Foundation, which focuses on providing education and support to impoverished children in Colombia. She is also a UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador and has been involved in various humanitarian efforts, including campaigns for children's rights and disaster relief.

Shakira's personal life has also been in the public eye. She has been in a long-term relationship with Spanish professional footballer Gerard Piqué since 2011. The couple has two sons together, Milan and Sasha.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Philippe Coutinho.
output:
Philippe Coutinho Correia, commonly known as Philippe Coutinho, is a Brazilian professional footballer who was born on June 12, 1992, in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. He primarily plays as an attacking midfielder or winger and is renowned for his dribbling skills, vision, and long-range shooting ability.

Coutinho began his footballing journey at the Vasco da Gama academy in Brazil before moving to Europe and joining Italian side Inter Milan in 2008. However, he officially joined the team in 2010 due to the transfer regulations concerning non-European minors. He struggled to establish himself as a regular starter at Inter and was loaned to Spanish side Espanyol in 2012.

In January 2013, Coutinho signed with English Premier League club Liverpool FC for a reported £8.5 million. During his time at Liverpool, he quickly became a fan favorite and earned the nickname "The Little Magician" for his skillful performances. He scored 54 goals in 201 appearances for the club and was named Liverpool's Player of the Year in 2015 and 2016.

In January 2018, Coutinho completed a high-profile move to Spanish giants FC Barcelona for a reported fee of €120 million, potentially rising to €160 million with add-ons, making him one of the most expensive players in football history. He won the La Liga title and Copa del Rey in his first season with the club, but his time at Barcelona was filled with mixed performances and expectations.

In the summer of 2019, Coutinho was loaned to German club Bayern Munich, where he went on to win the treble, which included the Bundesliga, DFB-Pokal, and UEFA Champions League titles. After completing his loan spell at Bayern Munich, he returned to Barcelona.

On the international stage, Coutinho has represented Brazil at various youth levels and made his senior debut in 2010. He has since participated in numerous international tournaments, including the 2015 Copa America, 2016 Copa America Centenario, and 2018 FIFA World Cup. Coutinho played a crucial role in Brazil's 2019 Copa America victory, scoring two goals during the tournament.

Throughout his career, Philippe Coutinho has demonstrated exceptional talent and versatility, contributing significantly to the success of the clubs and national team he has represented.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Ronaldinho.
output:
Ronaldo de Assis Moreira, commonly known as Ronaldinho, was born on March 21, 1980, in Porto Alegre, Brazil. He is a retired professional footballer who is widely regarded as one of the most talented and skillful players in the history of the sport. Ronaldinho played as an attacking midfielder and forward, and he gained international fame for his exceptional dribbling skills, creativity, and ability to score goals.

Ronaldinho began his football career at a young age, joining the youth ranks of Brazilian club Grêmio in 1997. His talent quickly caught the attention of European clubs, and in 2001, he signed with French team Paris Saint-Germain (PSG). During his time at PSG, Ronaldinho showcased his skills on a larger stage and earned a spot on the Brazilian national team.

In 2002, Ronaldinho played a crucial role in Brazil's World Cup-winning campaign, scoring important goals and providing key assists. This success further elevated his profile, and in 2003, he signed with Spanish giants FC Barcelona. At Barcelona, Ronaldinho reached the pinnacle of his career, winning numerous domestic and international titles, including two La Liga championships, two Spanish Super Cups, and the 2005-06 UEFA Champions League.

Individually, Ronaldinho won the prestigious FIFA World Player of the Year award in 2004 and 2005, and the Ballon d'Or in 2005. His mesmerizing skills, dazzling tricks, and infectious smile made him a fan favorite worldwide.

In 2008, Ronaldinho moved to Italian club AC Milan, where he played for three seasons before returning to Brazil to join Flamengo in 2011. He later played for Atlético Mineiro, Querétaro, and Fluminense before officially retiring in 2018.

Throughout his career, Ronaldinho earned 97 caps for the Brazilian national team and scored 33 goals. His impact on the game and his contribution to the sport will always be remembered as one of the greatest in football history.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Anderson Silva.
output:
Anderson Silva, full name Anderson da Silva, was born on April 14, 1975, in São Paulo, Brazil. He is a Brazilian mixed martial artist and former UFC Middleweight Champion. Silva is widely regarded as one of the greatest fighters in the history of mixed martial arts (MMA).

Growing up in a poor family, Silva began training in martial arts at a young age. He started with Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu and later expanded to include Muay Thai, boxing, and Taekwondo. Silva made his professional MMA debut in 1997 and spent the early part of his career fighting in various promotions around the world, including Brazil's Mecca organization and Japan's PRIDE Fighting Championships.

In 2006, Silva made his UFC debut, winning his first fight against Chris Leben. He then went on to defeat Rich Franklin to claim the UFC Middleweight Championship. Silva held the title for a record 2,457 days, successfully defending it 10 times between 2006 and 2013. During this time, he also set the record for the longest winning streak in UFC history with 16 consecutive victories.

In 2013, Silva's reign came to an end when he was defeated by Chris Weidman, losing the Middleweight Championship. A subsequent rematch resulted in a devastating leg injury for Silva, sidelining him for an extended period.

Despite facing numerous setbacks, including a failed drug test in 2015 and multiple surgeries, Silva continued to compete in the UFC until 2020. He was released from the organization in November 2020, following a loss to Uriah Hall.

Throughout his career, Anderson Silva has been praised for his striking skills, elusiveness, and ability to finish fights with both submissions and knockouts. His incredible talent and fighting spirit have earned him a place among the all-time greats in MMA history.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Cleopatra.
output:
Cleopatra VII Philopator (69 BCE – 30 BCE) was the last active Pharaoh of Ancient Egypt, belonging to the Ptolemaic dynasty. Born in Alexandria, she was the daughter of Pharaoh Ptolemy XII Auletes and Cleopatra V Tryphaena. Cleopatra is well-known for her exceptional intelligence, wit, and beauty, as well as her romantic relationships with two powerful Roman generals, Julius Caesar and Mark Antony.

Cleopatra ascended to the throne at the age of 18, following her father's death in 51 BCE. Initially, she co-ruled with her younger brother Ptolemy XIII, who was also her husband due to dynastic customs. However, sibling rivalry and political tensions led to a civil war between the two. In 48 BCE, Julius Caesar arrived in Egypt, and Cleopatra saw an opportunity to solidify her position. She formed a romantic and political alliance with Caesar, leading to her brother's defeat and death in the Battle of the Nile in 47 BCE.

Cleopatra then became the sole ruler of Egypt and had a son with Caesar, named Caesarion. After Caesar's assassination in 44 BCE, Cleopatra formed another alliance, this time with Mark Antony, one of Caesar's supporters and a member of the Second Triumvirate. They had three children together and aimed to consolidate their power in the Eastern Mediterranean.

The relationship between Cleopatra and Mark Antony alarmed Rome, and tensions eventually escalated into a military conflict, with Octavian (later known as Emperor Augustus) leading the Roman forces against them. In the Battle of Actium in 31 BCE, Octavian's fleet defeated the combined forces of Cleopatra and Antony, prompting them to retreat to Egypt.

In 30 BCE, as Octavian's forces closed in on Alexandria, Mark Antony committed suicide, believing that Cleopatra had already done so. Cleopatra, however, was still alive, and after realizing that she had no chance of negotiating with Octavian, she chose to end her life as well. The details of her death remain uncertain, but it is widely believed that she committed suicide by allowing a poisonous snake, an asp, to bite her.

Cleopatra's death marked the end of the Ptolemaic dynasty and the Hellenistic period, as Egypt became a province of the Roman Empire. Her life has been the subject of numerous works of art, literature, and film, making her one of the most enduring and intriguing figures of ancient history.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Michael Douglas.
output:
Michael Douglas, full name Michael Kirk Douglas, was born on September 25, 1944, in New Brunswick, New Jersey, USA. He is a well-known American actor and producer, and the son of legendary actor Kirk Douglas and actress Diana Dill.

Douglas attended the University of California, Santa Barbara, where he graduated with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Drama in 1968. He then attended The American Place Theatre in New York City to study acting under Wynn Handman. In 1969, Douglas made his acting debut in the CBS Playhouse production of "The Experiment." He gained recognition for his role as Inspector Steve Keller in the TV series "The Streets of San Francisco" (1972-1976).

Michael Douglas's breakthrough as a producer came in 1975 when he acquired the film rights to Ken Kesey's novel "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest." The film, starring Jack Nicholson, went on to win five Academy Awards, including Best Picture. As an actor, Douglas gained widespread fame for his role as Gordon Gekko in the 1987 film "Wall Street," for which he won an Academy Award for Best Actor.

Throughout his career, he has appeared in numerous successful films, including "Fatal Attraction" (1987), "The War of the Roses" (1989), "Basic Instinct" (1992), "Disclosure" (1994), "The American President" (1995), "The Game" (1997), "Traffic" (2000), and "Wonder Boys" (2000). In 2010, he reprised his role as Gordon Gekko in "Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps."

Michael Douglas also starred as Dr. Hank Pym in the Marvel Cinematic Universe films "Ant-Man" (2015) and "Ant-Man and the Wasp" (2018). 

In his personal life, Douglas was married to Diandra Luker from 1977 to 2000, with whom he has a son, Cameron. In 2000, he married actress Catherine Zeta-Jones, and they have two children together, Dylan and Carys.

Over the years, Michael Douglas has received various awards and honors, including two Academy Awards, five Golden Globe Awards, a Primetime Emmy Award, and the AFI Life Achievement Award in 2009. His contributions to the film industry have made him one of the most respected and accomplished actors and producers in Hollywood.

Franck Ribéry, born April 7, 1983, in Boulogne-sur-Mer, France, is a professional footballer who has played as a winger for various clubs and the French national team. Ribéry is known for his pace, dribbling skills, and crossing ability, which have earned him the nickname "Ferraribéry."

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Griselda Blanco.
output:
Griselda Blanco, also known as "La Madrina," "The Black Widow," and the "Cocaine Godmother," was a notorious Colombian drug lord who played a significant role in the Miami-based cocaine trade during the 1970s and 1980s. Born on February 15, 1943, in Cartagena, Colombia, Blanco grew up in extreme poverty and endured a difficult childhood. She was involved in criminal activities from an early age, including pickpocketing and prostitution.

Blanco moved to Medellín, Colombia, in the early 1970s and became involved in the city's burgeoning drug trade. She established her own drug trafficking network, which eventually expanded into the United States. Blanco was one of the pioneer members of the infamous Medellín Cartel, led by the notorious drug lord, Pablo Escobar.

In the mid-1970s, Blanco moved to Queens, New York, where she continued her drug operations. By the late 1970s, her network had grown significantly, and she relocated to Miami, Florida. Her ruthless and violent methods earned her the nickname "The Black Widow." Blanco was known for her innovative smuggling techniques, including the use of customized lingerie with hidden compartments to transport drugs.

Blanco's reign over the Miami drug scene was marked by extreme violence, leading to an era known as the "Cocaine Cowboys" period. Her organization was responsible for numerous murders and violent crimes in the area.

Griselda Blanco was eventually arrested by the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) in 1985 in Irvine, California. She was charged with various drug-related crimes, including conspiracy to manufacture, distribute, and import cocaine into the United States. Blanco was sentenced to over a decade in prison and was deported back to Colombia upon her release in 2004.

On September 3, 2012, Griselda Blanco was assassinated in Medellín, Colombia, in a drive-by shooting. Her death marked the end of a notorious and violent chapter in the history of drug trafficking.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Kaoru Kuroki.

She appeared on television talk shows and variety programs, often discussing topics related to the adult entertainment industry, women's rights, and sexual health. Kuroki has also written several books, including "Panty Hose & High Heels" (1991) and "Kaoru Kuroki's Adult Video Course" (1992), which offer insights into her experiences as an adult film actress and her thoughts on the industry. Although she retired from the adult film industry in the early 1990s, Kaoru Kuroki remains an influential figure in Japanese popular culture and is widely regarded as one of the pioneers of the modern AV industry.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Manny Pacquiao.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Karl Urban.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of RM (rapper).
output:
RM, born as Kim Namjoon on September 12, 1994, in Ilsan, South Korea, is a rapper, songwriter, and record producer who is most well-known as the leader and main rapper of the South Korean boy band, BTS (Bangtan Sonyeondan). input: Question: Tell me a bio of Xi Jinping.
output:
Xi Jinping, born June 15, 1953, in Beijing, China, is a Chinese politician who currently serves as the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China, the President of the People's Republic of China, and the Chairman of the Central Military Commission. He is considered one of China's most powerful leaders in recent history.

Xi Jinping comes from a prominent political family; his father, Xi Zhongxun, was a revolutionary veteran and held various high-ranking positions within the Communist Party. During the Cultural Revolution, Xi Jinping's family faced political persecution, and he was sent to the rural village of Liangjiahe in Shaanxi province for "re-education" through manual labor. This experience shaped his political outlook and determination.

In 1974, Xi Jinping joined the Communist Party of China and began his political career. He held various positions in local and provincial governments and party organizations, gradually rising through the ranks. In 2007, he was appointed as the Party Chief of Shanghai, and later that year, he joined the Politburo Standing Committee, the highest decision-making body in China.

In November 2012, Xi Jinping was elected as the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China during the 18th National Congress. In March 2013, he became the President of the People's Republic of China, succeeding Hu Jintao. As the leader of China, Xi Jinping has pursued a strong and assertive approach to domestic and foreign policy, with notable initiatives including anti-corruption campaigns, economic reforms, and the Belt and Road Initiative.

Under Xi Jinping's leadership, China has sought to expand its global influence and strengthen its military capabilities. His tenure has also seen increased control over the media, civil society, and the internet, as well as the suppression of dissent and human rights abuses, particularly in Xinjiang and Tibet.

In 2018, term limits for the Chinese presidency were abolished, allowing Xi Jinping to potentially serve as the leader of China indefinitely. This move has further solidified his position as one of the most powerful and influential figures in modern Chinese history.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Robert Whittaker (fighter).
output:
Robert Whittaker is a professional mixed martial artist (MMA) from Australia, born on December 20, 1990, in Sydney. He is best known for competing in the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC), where he is a former UFC Middleweight Champion.

Whittaker began his martial arts journey at a young age, starting with karate, Hapkido, and then transitioning to mixed martial arts. He made his professional MMA debut in 2009 and was successful in the Australian regional circuit. His early career included impressive performances in various promotions like Cage Fighting Championship and Australian Fighting Championship.

In 2012, Whittaker gained international recognition when he participated in "The Ultimate Fighter: The Smashes," which was a television series and UFC-produced reality show. Competing as a welterweight, he won the competition and earned a contract with the UFC.

After a few bouts in the welterweight division, Robert Whittaker decided to move up to the middleweight division in 2014. This decision proved to be a turning point in his career, as he went on a remarkable winning streak, defeating notable opponents such as Derek Brunson, Ronaldo "Jacare" Souza, and Yoel Romero (twice).

In July 2017, Whittaker became the interim UFC Middleweight Champion after defeating Yoel Romero at UFC 213. Later that year, he was promoted to the undisputed champion when then-champion Georges St-Pierre vacated the title. Whittaker defended his title against Yoel Romero in a non-title bout at UFC 225 due to Romero missing weight. In October 2019, Whittaker lost his title to Israel Adesanya at UFC 243.

Robert Whittaker is known for his striking skills, grappling, and well-rounded fighting abilities. Outside of the Octagon, Whittaker is a devoted family man, married to Sofia Whittaker, with whom he shares three children. He is actively involved in charity work and often gives back to the community by teaching martial arts to disadvantaged youth.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Anurag Kashyap.
output:
Anurag Kashyap is an acclaimed Indian film director, producer, screenwriter, and actor known for his distinctive style of filmmaking and contributions to Indian cinema, particularly in the independent film industry. Born on September 10, 1972, in Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh, India, Kashyap grew up in the towns of Saharanpur and Dehradun.

He initially pursued a degree in zoology from Hans Raj College, University of Delhi, but later developed an interest in theatre and joined a street theatre group, Jana Natya Manch. In 1993, he attended the International Film Festival of India, which further fueled his passion for cinema. He then moved to Mumbai to pursue a career in filmmaking.

Kashyap began his career as a writer, contributing to the screenplay of the critically acclaimed film "Satya" (1998), directed by Ram Gopal Varma. He continued to write for various films, like "Shool" (1999) and "Yuva" (2004), before making his directorial debut with "Paanch" (2000), which faced censorship issues and was never released commercially.

However, it was his film "Black Friday" (2007), based on the 1993 Bombay bombings, that brought him to the forefront of Indian cinema. The film won critical acclaim and several awards. Kashyap continued to direct successful films like "Dev.D" (2009), "Gulaal" (2009), "Gangs of Wasseypur" (2012), and "Ugly" (2013), cementing his position as a visionary filmmaker.

In addition to directing, Kashyap has produced numerous films, including "Udaan" (2010), "The Lunchbox" (2013), and "Masaan" (2015), which have garnered both critical and commercial success. As an actor, he has appeared in films like "Black Friday," "Shagird," "I Am," and "Akira."

Known for his unconventional storytelling and dark themes, Anurag Kashyap has become a prominent figure in the Indian film industry. His contributions have shaped the landscape of independent cinema, earning him a reputation as a risk-taker and auteur.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Vijay (actor).
output:
C. Joseph Vijay Chandrasekhar, known professionally as Vijay, is an Indian film actor and playback singer who works primarily in the Tamil film industry. Born on June 22, 1974, in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, Vijay is the son of the renowned film director S.A. Chandrasekhar and playback singer Shoba Chandrasekhar. He grew up in a family deeply rooted in the film industry, which helped shape his career.

Vijay made his acting debut as a child artist in the 1984 film "Vetri," directed by his father. He continued to act in a few more films as a child artist before taking a break to focus on his education. In 1992, Vijay made his debut as a leading actor with the film "Naalaiya Theerpu," also directed by his father. Despite a slow start to his career, Vijay gradually gained prominence and established himself as a successful actor in Tamil cinema.

Some of his notable films include "Poove Unakkaga" (1996), "Kadhalukku Mariyadhai" (1997), "Ghilli" (2004), "Thuppakki" (2012), "Kaththi" (2014), "Mersal" (2017), and "Sarkar" (2018). Vijay's performances have earned him several awards and honors, including multiple Tamil Nadu State Film Awards and Edison Awards.

In addition to acting, Vijay has also ventured into playback singing, lending his voice to several songs in his films. He is known for his energetic dance moves and has a strong fan following, earning him the nickname "Thalapathy" (Commander) among his supporters.

Vijay is actively involved in philanthropy and has established the Vijay Makkal Iyakkam, a social welfare organization that supports various causes such as education, health, and disaster relief. He is also an ambassador for the Indian Premier League (IPL) cricket team Chennai Super Kings.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Kajal Aggarwal.
output:
Kajal Aggarwal is an Indian actress and model known for her work primarily in the South Indian film industry, as well as in Bollywood. She was born on June 19, 1985, in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. Her parents are Vinay Aggarwal, an entrepreneur, and Suman Aggarwal, a confectioner. Kajal has a younger sister named Nisha Aggarwal, who is also an actress.

Kajal completed her schooling at St. Anne's High School in Mumbai and later pursued a degree in Mass Media from Jai Hind College. She began her career in modeling and acting while still in college.

Aggarwal made her acting debut in the 2004 Bollywood film "Kyun! Ho Gaya Na..." in a minor role. She got her first leading role in the 2007 Telugu film "Lakshmi Kalyanam," directed by Teja. Her breakthrough came with the 2009 Telugu film "Magadheera," where she starred opposite Ram Charan Teja. The film was a massive success and established Kajal as a leading actress in the South Indian film industry.

She went on to star in several successful Telugu, Tamil, and Hindi films, such as "Darling" (2010), "Mr. Perfect" (2011), "Businessman" (2012), "Thuppakki" (2012), "Jilla" (2014), and "Special 26" (2013) in Bollywood. Kajal has received numerous awards for her performances and has also been nominated for various categories in the film industry.

In addition to acting, Kajal Aggarwal endorses various brands and is involved in philanthropic activities. She is an ambassador for the NGO "Think Peace" and supports the education of underprivileged children.

On October 30, 2020, Kajal Aggarwal married entrepreneur Gautam Kitchlu in a private ceremony in Mumbai.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Kiara Advani.
output:
Kiara Advani, born as Alia Advani on July 31, 1992, is a popular Indian actress known primarily for her work in Hindi and Telugu-language films. She was born in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India, into a family with a rich cultural background—her father, Jagdeep Advani, is a Sindhi businessman, and her mother, Genevieve Jaffrey, is of half British and half Punjabi descent.

Kiara made her acting debut in the 2014 Bollywood film "Fugly," directed by Kabir Sadanand. Although the film received mixed reviews, Kiara's performance was noted for her potential. Her big break came when she was cast in the 2016 biographical sports film "M.S. Dhoni: The Untold Story," where she played the role of Sakshi Dhoni, the wife of Indian cricketer M.S. Dhoni. The film was a commercial success, and her performance was widely appreciated.

In 2018, Kiara appeared in the Telugu film "Bharat Ane Nenu" alongside Mahesh Babu, which was a massive hit at the box office. She continued her success with the 2019 Hindi film "Kabir Singh," a remake of the Telugu film "Arjun Reddy." Her performance as Preeti Sikka, opposite Shahid Kapoor, was praised by critics and audiences alike, and the film became one of the highest-grossing Bollywood films of that year.

Kiara has also starred in Netflix's anthology film "Lust Stories" (2018) and the comedy film "Good Newwz" (2019), among other projects. With her diverse roles and acting prowess, Kiara Advani has established herself as a talented and sought-after actress in the Indian film industry.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Muhammad Ali Jinnah.
output:
Muhammad Ali Jinnah, born on December 25, 1876, in Karachi, British India (now in Pakistan), was a prominent lawyer, politician, and the founder of Pakistan. Jinnah played a pivotal role in the creation of the nation-state after the partition of India in 1947.

Jinnah grew up in a wealthy, merchant family and excelled academically. He studied at the Sindh Madrasa High School in Karachi and later moved to England to study law at Lincoln's Inn in London. In 1896, he became the youngest Indian to be called to the Bar.

After returning to India in 1897, Jinnah began his career as a lawyer and soon gained prominence in the legal community. He joined the Indian National Congress in 1906 and worked towards achieving greater political autonomy for India. However, Jinnah grew disillusioned with the Congress Party's methods and objectives and eventually joined the All India Muslim League in 1913.

As a member of the Muslim League, Jinnah advocated for the rights and interests of the Muslim population in British India. He played a significant role in the Lucknow Pact of 1916, which brought the Congress and the Muslim League together for a united front against British colonial rule.

Over time, Jinnah became more concerned about the potential marginalization of Muslims in a predominantly Hindu India. In 1940, he put forward the Two-Nation Theory, which argued that Hindus and Muslims were two distinct nations and should have separate political entities. This theory laid the foundation for the demand for a separate Muslim state – Pakistan.

Jinnah's unwavering commitment to the cause of Pakistan earned him the title "Quaid-e-Azam" or "Great Leader." He led the Muslim League in negotiations with the British government and the Indian National Congress during the 1940s, ultimately resulting in the partition of British India into the two independent nations of India and Pakistan in August 1947.

Upon the creation of Pakistan, Jinnah became the country's first Governor-General and was instrumental in establishing its political and administrative structure. However, Jinnah's tenure as Governor-General was short-lived, as he passed away on September 11, 1948, due to complications from tuberculosis.

Muhammad Ali Jinnah is remembered as a key architect of Pakistan and a champion for Muslim rights in British India. His vision, leadership, and determination played a crucial role in the formation of the nation and continue to inspire generations of Pakistanis.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Joel Edgerton.
output:
Joel Edgerton is an Australian actor, director, and screenwriter, born on June 23, 1974, in Blacktown, New South Wales, Australia. He began his career in the late 1990s, appearing in Australian television series and films before gaining international recognition.

Edgerton attended the Hills Grammar School and later studied at the Nepean Drama School at the University of Western Sydney. He started his acting career with various stage productions and television shows, including a role in the Australian TV series "Spellbinder" (1995) and "Water Rats" (1996).

His first major film role came in the crime drama "Animal Kingdom" (2010), which garnered critical acclaim and multiple awards. This helped catapult Edgerton into the international spotlight. He went on to appear in various high-profile films such as "Warrior" (2011), "Zero Dark Thirty" (2012), "The Great Gatsby" (2013), "Exodus: Gods and Kings" (2014), and "Black Mass" (2015).

As a writer and director, Edgerton has also made significant contributions to the film industry. He co-wrote and starred in the Australian film "The Square" (2008) and made his directorial debut with the psychological thriller "The Gift" (2015), which he also wrote and starred in. In 2018, he directed, wrote, and starred in the critically acclaimed film "Boy Erased," which tackled the issue of conversion therapy.

Throughout his career, Joel Edgerton has received numerous awards and nominations for his work in acting, writing, and directing. His versatile talent and contributions to the film industry have made him a prominent figure in both Australian and international cinema.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Damon Herriman.
output:
Damon Herriman is an Australian actor, born on March 31, 1970, in Adelaide, South Australia. He began his acting career at a young age, appearing in local television commercials before transitioning to television shows and films. Herriman is best known for his versatile acting skills and his ability to portray a wide range of characters.

In Australia, Herriman gained recognition for his roles in popular television series such as "Love My Way" (2004-2007), "The Sullivans" (1976-1983), and "Water Rats" (1996-2001). He also appeared in the critically acclaimed Australian film "The Square" (2008), directed by Nash Edgerton.

Herriman's international career took off when he was cast as Dewey Crowe in the hit American television series "Justified" (2010-2015). His performance in this role garnered him much attention and praise. Since then, he has appeared in numerous American television shows and films, including "Quarry" (2016), "Top of the Lake: China Girl" (2017), and "Flesh and Bone" (2015).

In recent years, Herriman has portrayed the infamous cult leader Charles Manson twice, first in Quentin Tarantino's "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood" (2019) and then in the television series "Mindhunter" (2019). His other notable film roles include "J. Edgar" (2011), directed by Clint Eastwood, and "The Nightingale" (2018), directed by Jennifer Kent.

Throughout his career, Damon Herriman has been praised for his acting skills, ability to immerse himself in diverse roles, and his dedication to his craft.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Rohit Sharma.
output:
Rohit Gurunath Sharma, born on April 30, 1987, is an Indian international cricketer who serves as the vice-captain of the Indian national team in limited-overs formats. He is a right-handed batsman and occasionally bowls right-arm off break. Rohit is known for his elegant batting style, timing, and ability to score big runs, especially in One Day Internationals (ODIs) and T20 matches.

Born in Nagpur, Maharashtra, India, Rohit Sharma began his cricketing journey at a young age, playing in school and club cricket before making his way to the under-17 and under-19 Indian cricket teams. He made his first-class debut for Mumbai in 2006, and his consistent performances caught the attention of the national selectors.

Rohit made his international debut in 2007, playing in a One Day International (ODI) against Ireland. Over the years, he has established himself as one of the best limited-overs batsmen in the world. In 2013, he was promoted to open the innings, which proved to be a turning point in his career as he began to score consistently and heavily.

Some of Rohit Sharma's career highlights include being the only player to score three double centuries in ODIs, holding the record for the highest individual score in an ODI with 264 runs, and scoring the fastest T20 International century off just 35 balls. He has also won numerous awards for his performances, including the prestigious Arjuna Award in 2015.

Apart from his success in limited-overs cricket, Rohit Sharma has also been a regular member of the Indian Test team since 2013, with notable performances in both home and away series. He has captained the Mumbai Indians in the Indian Premier League (IPL) since 2013, leading the team to five IPL titles (2013, 2015, 2017, 2019, and 2020).

Off the field, Rohit is an advocate for animal welfare and environmental conservation. He is married to Ritika Sajdeh, and the couple has a daughter named Samaira.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of 14th Dalai Lama.
output:
The 14th Dalai Lama, whose birth name is Lhamo Thondup, was born on July 6, 1935, in the small village of Takster in northeastern Tibet. He was recognized as the reincarnation of the 13th Dalai Lama, Thubten Gyatso when he was just two years old. Consequently, he was renamed Tenzin Gyatso and began his monastic education at the age of six.

In 1950, at the age of 15, Tenzin Gyatso was formally enthroned as the 14th Dalai Lama, the spiritual and temporal leader of Tibet. His ascension to power was overshadowed by the Chinese invasion of Tibet. In the following years, the Dalai Lama attempted to negotiate with the Chinese government, seeking autonomy for Tibet while maintaining its cultural and religious heritage.

However, in 1959, following a failed uprising against Chinese rule, the Dalai Lama was forced to flee Tibet and seek asylum in India. He established the Central Tibetan Administration (CTA) in Dharamsala, India, which has become the base for the Tibetan government-in-exile.

Since then, the Dalai Lama has dedicated his life to the nonviolent struggle for Tibet's autonomy and the preservation of Tibetan culture. He has traveled the world, engaging in interfaith dialogue, promoting peace and compassion, and meeting with political leaders to discuss the Tibetan cause. In 1989, he was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in recognition of his efforts to promote peace and nonviolence.

The Dalai Lama has also authored numerous books on spirituality, ethics, and philosophy, and he maintains an active presence on social media, reaching out to millions of followers.

As the spiritual leader of Tibetan Buddhism, the 14th Dalai Lama continues to inspire millions around the world with his teachings and actions, advocating for compassion, peace, and the resolution of conflicts through dialogue and understanding.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Ahn Jae-hyun.
output:
Ahn Jae-hyun is a South Korean actor and model who was born on July 1, 1987, in Seoul, South Korea. He began his career as a fashion model in 2009, walking the runway for various designers and participating in fashion shows. His tall, lean frame and distinctive features quickly made him a popular figure in the modeling world.

Ahn Jae-hyun made his acting debut in 2011 with a small role in the television series "High Kick: Revenge of the Short Legged." He continued to appear in various TV dramas and gained wider recognition with his role in the 2013 hit drama "You're All Surrounded." His breakthrough role came in 2015 when he played the vampire doctor in the popular television series "Blood." This performance earned him several awards and helped establish him as a leading actor in the South Korean entertainment industry.

Since then, he has starred in numerous TV series and films, including "Cinderella and Four Knights" (2016), "Reunited Worlds" (2017), "The Beauty Inside" (2018), and "Love with Flaws" (2019). He has also appeared on various variety shows, showcasing his charm and wit.

In addition to his acting career, Ahn Jae-hyun is known for his philanthropic efforts, regularly participating in charity events and donating to various causes. In 2016, he married fellow actress Ku Hye-sun, but the couple announced their divorce in 2019.

Overall, Ahn Jae-hyun has established himself as a talented actor and model, captivating audiences with his diverse range of roles and his undeniable charisma.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Lokesh Kanagaraj.
output:
Lokesh Kanagaraj is an Indian film director and screenwriter, predominantly working in the Tamil film industry. Born on July 14, 1986, in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, India, Lokesh graduated with a Bachelor of Engineering degree in Computer Science from KGiSL Institute of Technology, Coimbatore. Initially, he worked in the IT sector in Chennai and the United States but later decided to follow his passion for filmmaking.

Lokesh's directorial journey began with a series of short films, including "Kaalam," "Kalaivu," "Guru," and "Piriyaadha Ulagam." His first notable work was "Kaalam," a short film that won the Best Screenplay Award at the Norway Tamil Film Festival in 2013. This success provided him with the opportunity to enter the Tamil film industry.

Lokesh made his feature film directorial debut with the 2017 film "Maanagaram," a critically acclaimed thriller that showcased his unique storytelling style and established him as a promising director in the industry. He followed it up with "Kaithi" in 2019, starring Karthi in the lead role. The film was a commercial success and received widespread acclaim for its gripping plot and intense action sequences.

In 2020, Lokesh directed "Master," starring two of the Tamil film industry's biggest stars, Vijay and Vijay Sethupathi. The film was highly anticipated and became a massive box office hit upon release in 2021, further cementing his status as a talented director.

Lokesh Kanagaraj continues to work on various projects, constantly evolving his craft, and delivering engaging films that captivate audiences.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Joji (musician).
output:
Joji, born George Kusunoki Miller on September 18, 1992, is a Japanese-Australian singer, songwriter, record producer, and former Internet personality. He first gained fame on the Internet under the pseudonyms Filthy Frank and Pink Guy, creating comedic content and music on his YouTube channel. However, Joji retired from his comedic persona in 2017 to focus on his music career.

Joji's musical style is a blend of lo-fi, trip-hop, and R&B elements that often convey melancholic themes. He gained significant attention with his debut single "Will He" in 2017, which paved the way for his first major project, the EP "In Tongues," under the label 88rising. The EP received positive reviews and further established Joji in the music industry.

In 2018, Joji released his debut studio album, "BALLADS 1," which included popular singles like "Slow Dancing in the Dark" and "Yeah Right." The album reached number one on the Billboard Top R&B/Hip-Hop Albums chart, making Joji the first Asian-born artist to achieve this feat.

Following the success of his first album, Joji released his second studio album, "Nectar," in September 2020. The album features collaborations with artists like Diplo, BENEE, and Lil Yachty. "Nectar" received positive reviews and showcased Joji's growth as an artist, with singles like "Run," "Gimme Love," and "Ew" gaining popularity.

Throughout his music career, Joji has been recognized for his unique sound and emotive songwriting, earning him a dedicated fanbase and significant success in the industry.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Iggy Azalea.
output:
Iggy Azalea, born Amethyst Amelia Kelly on June 7, 1990, is an Australian rapper, singer, songwriter, and model. She was raised in Mullumbimby, New South Wales, Australia, and moved to the United States at the age of 16 to pursue her music career.

In 2011, Iggy Azalea gained attention with her debut mixtape, "Ignorant Art," which featured her controversial single "Pu$$y." Her 2012 EP "Glory" helped to further establish her presence in the music industry. In 2013, she signed with Island Def Jam, and then with Mercury Records, which led to the release of her debut studio album, "The New Classic," in 2014. The album featured the hit singles "Work," "Bounce," and "Change Your Life."

Her major breakthrough came with the release of the single "Fancy," featuring Charli XCX, which topped the US Billboard Hot 100 chart, making her the fourth solo female rapper to achieve this milestone. The same year, she also released the single "Black Widow," featuring Rita Ora, which reached the Top 5 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart.

Although Iggy Azalea faced criticisms and controversies throughout her career, she has managed to secure several accolades, including Billboard Music Awards, American Music Awards, and MTV Video Music Awards.

Her subsequent releases include the 2018 EP "Survive the Summer" and the 2019 album "In My Defense." Iggy Azalea has been open about her struggles with mental health and has taken breaks from the music industry to focus on her well-being. Despite the challenges, she continues to remain an influential figure in the hip-hop and pop music scenes.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Jackie Shroff.
output:
Jackie Shroff, born as Jai Kishan Kakubhai Shroff on February 1, 1957, is an Indian actor who has appeared in over 220 films in various languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, and Marathi. He was born in Udgir, Maharashtra, India, and grew up in a modest neighborhood in Mumbai.

Shroff made his acting debut in the 1982 film "Swami Dada," directed by Dev Anand. However, it was his breakthrough role in Subhash Ghai's 1983 film "Hero" that catapulted him to stardom. His portrayal of the character "Jackie," a street-smart, rebellious young man, resonated with audiences and established him as a leading actor in the Indian film industry.

Over his career spanning more than three decades, Jackie Shroff has worked in a variety of genres and has portrayed diverse characters, ranging from romantic leads to action heroes and supporting roles. Some of his notable films include "Ram Lakhan" (1989), "Parinda" (1989), "Khalnayak" (1993), "Rangeela" (1995), "Border" (1997), and "Devdas" (2002).

Shroff's acting prowess has been recognized with several awards, including two Filmfare Awards for Best Actor for his performances in "Parinda" and "Khalnayak," and a Filmfare Lifetime Achievement Award in 2017.

In addition to his acting career, Jackie Shroff has also been involved in philanthropic activities, supporting causes such as environmental conservation, healthcare, and education. He is married to Ayesha Shroff and has two children, Tiger Shroff, who is also an actor, and Krishna Shroff.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Cha Eun-woo.
output:
Cha Eun-woo, born Lee Dong-min, is a South Korean singer, actor, and model. He was born on March 30, 1997, in Gunpo, Gyeonggi Province, South Korea. Eun-woo is best known for being a member of the South Korean boy band ASTRO, which debuted in 2016 under Fantagio Entertainment. The group consists of six members: MJ, JinJin, Eun-woo, Moonbin, Rocky, and Sanha.

Eun-woo began his career as a model in 2013, appearing in commercials and print ads. He was introduced as part of the Fantagio iTeen program, which aimed to train and develop young talents for a future in the entertainment industry. Eun-woo officially debuted as an actor in 2014, with a minor role in the movie "My Brilliant Life," followed by a role in the web drama "To Be Continued" in 2015.

Following his debut with ASTRO in 2016, Eun-woo gained popularity and recognition for his outstanding visuals and talents in singing and dancing. In addition to his work with ASTRO, he has pursued acting roles in various television dramas. Some of his notable works include "The Best Hit" (2017), "My ID is Gangnam Beauty" (2018), "Rookie Historian Goo Hae-Ryung" (2019), and "True Beauty" (2020-2021).

Eun-woo has also appeared in variety shows and has been a host for several music programs. With his multifaceted talents and charming personality, Cha Eun-woo continues to rise in popularity and establish a successful career in the South Korean entertainment industry.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Nick Kyrgios.
output:
Nick Kyrgios, born Nicholas Hilmy Kyrgios on April 27, 1995, is an Australian professional tennis player of Greek and Malaysian descent. Known for his powerful serve and aggressive playing style, Kyrgios has achieved notable success on the ATP Tour since turning pro in 2013.

Born in Canberra, Australia, Kyrgios was introduced to tennis at a young age. He displayed exceptional talent and by his teenage years, he was already making a name for himself in the junior circuit. In 2013, he won the boys' singles title at the Australian Open, followed by the same title at Wimbledon later that year.

In 2014, Kyrgios gained worldwide recognition when, ranked 144th, he defeated then world No. 1 Rafael Nadal at Wimbledon, reaching the quarterfinals in his debut. This marked the beginning of his rise in the professional ranks.

Throughout his career, Kyrgios has achieved multiple milestones, including winning six ATP singles titles and reaching a career-high ranking of No. 13 in the world in October 2016. He has also represented Australia in the Davis Cup and the ATP Cup.

Despite his undeniable talent, Kyrgios has often been at the center of controversial incidents on and off the court, including arguments with officials, unsportsmanlike conduct, and occasional suspensions. Nevertheless, his charisma and skill have made him one of the most entertaining and polarizing figures in the world of tennis.
